channel.title: Cannot Connect to Server w/ Client Using No-IP
channel.description: I tried setting up No-IP and replacing my ServerIP in my client Loader from 127.0.0.1 to my No-IP but it is not connecting while it connects fine with 127.0.0.1. What's wrong? I portforwarded properly I am sure, I have done it before.

item.title: Cannot Connect to Server w/ Client Using No-IP
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

If the hostname is correctly resolving to your IP address then its almost certainly either a firewall or port-forwarding problem.

Read full topic
item.source: Cannot Connect to Server w/ Client Using No-IP

item.title: Cannot Connect to Server w/ Client Using No-IP
item.dc:creator: @xX4m4zingXx xX4m4zingXx
item.description:
@xX4m4zingXx wrote:

It has to do something with portforwarding
try to use your own public ip and see if that works
if that works it’s something with your no-ip
if it doesn’t work it means you didn’t portforward properly

Read full topic
item.source: Cannot Connect to Server w/ Client Using No-IP

item.title: Cannot Connect to Server w/ Client Using No-IP
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

127.0.0.1 is usually the login for someone hosting.

Read full topic
item.source: Cannot Connect to Server w/ Client Using No-IP
